intro: Anemonoides oregana, commonly known as the Oregon anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other similar species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It features showy, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals and numerous stamens. Its foliage consists of palmately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
